title: How to Make Seafood Gumbo

steps.headline: Make the roux (the broth-like aspect of the dish).
steps.description: Whisk flour and bacon drippings in a large skillet on medium-low heat. Continue stirring the mixture until a brown/mahogany color appears. This will usually take around 25 minutes. It is important to continue stirring and watching the heat so it will not burn.

steps.headline: Chop the garlic, celery, onion, and green bell pepper into medium-sized chunks.
steps.description: Add them to the roux, along with the cut pieces of andouille sausage. Let the mixture simmer on low heat.

steps.headline: Boil water in a very large pot.
steps.description: Add beef bouillon cubes. Continue stirring this mixture until the bouillon is all mixed in. Let the mixture simmer for 10 minutes on a low heat.

steps.headline: Add the salt, hot sauce, sugar, Cajun seasoning, thyme, stewed tomatoes, and bay leaves to the mixture.
Pour the roux into this mixture.
steps.description: Let it all simmer on low heat for about 45 minutes to an hour.

steps.headline: Measure out the bacon drippings.
steps.description: While everything is simmering, use about two tablespoons of melted bacon drippings and vinegar to cook the okra, before adding it to the roux. Dry off the okra after about ten minutes of cooking on low heat before adding it to the gumbo pot.

steps.headline: Add the seafood.
steps.description: After the okra has been added, add raw shrimp, crabmeat, and oysters to the roux. Along with the seafood, add half a packet of "Louisiana Gumbo mix".

steps.headline: Make sure all ingredients are stirred into the roux, bring the gumbo to a low-medium heat, cover and let simmer for 45 minutes.

text: Make the roux (the broth-like aspect of the dish). Whisk flour and bacon drippings in a large skillet on medium-low heat. Continue stirring the mixture until a brown/mahogany color appears. This will usually take around 25 minutes. It is important to continue stirring and watching the heat so it will not burn. Chop the garlic, celery, onion, and green bell pepper into medium-sized chunks. Add them to the roux, along with the cut pieces of andouille sausage. Let the mixture simmer on low heat. Boil water in a very large pot. Add beef bouillon cubes. Continue stirring this mixture until the bouillon is all mixed in. Let the mixture simmer for 10 minutes on a low heat. Add the salt, hot sauce, sugar, Cajun seasoning, thyme, stewed tomatoes, and bay leaves to the mixture.  Pour the roux into this mixture. Let it all simmer on low heat for about 45 minutes to an hour. Measure out the bacon drippings. While everything is simmering, use about two tablespoons of melted bacon drippings and vinegar to cook the okra, before adding it to the roux. Dry off the okra after about ten minutes of cooking on low heat before adding it to the gumbo pot. Add the seafood. After the okra has been added, add raw shrimp, crabmeat, and oysters to the roux. Along with the seafood, add half a packet of "Louisiana Gumbo mix". Make sure all ingredients are stirred into the roux, bring the gumbo to a low-medium heat, cover and let simmer for 45 minutes.  Pour the mixture over rice. Serve, and enjoy!
